description:
For the next generation of shredders. On this little mountain machine, your young ripper is ready to tackle the trails and cover some distance. With disc brakes and front suspension, it's a great ride to gain confidence off the pavement. The frame is light but with durable construction, striking a balance of fun and function. And it's designed to stand up to the learning curve of trail riding, so it's destined for heirloom status.

  • MEC designed frame uses 6061 aluminum for a durable yet light construction
  • RST Capa T20 suspension fork has 50mm of travel and can be locked-out for ease of climbing
  • 8-speed gearing gives a great range for trails or hills
  • Shimano Altus shifter and derailleur give reliable gear changes
  • Tektro Jr. hydraulic disc brakes with adjustable reach to match your child's hands
  • Kenda Amrak tires have great grip in both he dry and wet
  • Recommended age: 6 to 9 years
  • Recommended rider height: 120cm to 135cm (4ft. to 4ft. 5in.)
  • We put the Mountain back on our pint sized mountain bikes. These new versions have the same level components as the previous Ace Ltd. and Dash Ltd. but received a makeover to wear our classic mountain logo. Whichever design speaks to your heart, know that your little rider is getting a great bike
  • Bikes are covered by MEC's Rocksolid Guarantee and Bike Service Agreement. You can bring your bike to any MEC bike shop for free adjustments and minor maintenance for a year after purchase
  • MEC bikes were designed in Canada. Everything from the frames to the graphics was developed at the MEC Head Office in Vancouver, BC
  • Due to challenges with supply chain, components may be substituted for comparable parts at any time. The listed build is how MEC intended your bike to arrive, though the manufacturer may need to make a tweak or two to get you riding sooner
name: MEC Dash Ltd. Bicycle - Youths
